poem:
Title: "Caravaggio beyond M25"

Caravaggio in crimson, in the puzzle of trains,
Wishes not to be confined by walls or city lanes.
The gleam of his art yearns for provinces to see.
Why can't solitude and art in the heartland agree?
Ah, the trail of light and shadow he leaves,
As we envision his genius beyond the ring of M25's weave.
